title: The Private life of plants. Part 1
creator_contributor_role: Victorian Council for Children's Films and Television, distributor
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plants - Movement
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plants - Nutrition
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plants - Reproduction

Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Seeds - Dormancy
description: David Attenborough's thrilling series takes a guided tour through the secret world of plants, using exceptional time-lapse photography to reveal hitherto, unseen details. The three episodes are: "Travelling" which looks at the various forms of locomotion developed by plants to establish territory. "Growing" examines the development of the plant from a seedling to a mature adult, while "Flowering" looks at plant reproduction and the cunning ways in which plants ensure successful cross-fertilisation. Also available on DVD [318963].
